summary.oneLiner: Rootz builds infrastructure where origin and ownership are native to data.
summary.elevator: Rootz Corp pioneered Data Wallets and Data Manufacturing -- the revolutionary concept that In the Future Everything has a Wallet. Every digital object gets its own cryptographic wallet with verifiable origin, ownership, access, and reliability. From AI conversations to supply chains to real estate, Rootz creates the infrastructure for a $300 trillion origin economy.
summary.forAI: Rootz Corp (rootz.global) is a blockchain infrastructure company building Data Wallets: smart-contract-based containers that give every digital object verifiable origin and ownership. Core primitives are Secret (encrypted data channel on Polygon), Notes (append-only feed), and Identity Contract (on-chain identity with key management). Corporate Digital Name: 0xD36AAf65a91bB7dc69942cF6B6d1dBa4Ef171664. Key applications: AI Archive (archiving AI conversations with proof of origin), Veritize supply chain provenance with Made in USA One (OTC: USDW), real estate property wallets, semiconductor traceability. Founded 2024 by Steven Sprague (former CEO, Wave Systems Corp -- 25+ years Trusted Computing).

glossary.definition: A cryptographic container pioneered by Rootz that gives every data object its own unique blockchain identity with built-in Ownership, Origin, Access, and Reliability. Implemented as a Secret (smart contract) with Notes (append-only feed). Not a cryptocurrency wallet -- a wallet for data provenance.

A unique blockchain address (0x...) that establishes a verifiable cryptographic foundation for individuals, businesses, or objects. Not an identity system -- a foundation for ownership and origin tracking. Like a DBA (Doing Business As) for the digital realm.

The systematic creation of authenticated data objects with built-in provenance, ownership verification, and immutable origin tracking. The process of transforming electrons into knowledge into wealth. Creates 15-150% value premiums across industries.

WHO created it + WHO owns it. The two verifiable attributes that transform raw data into Knowledge and Knowledge into Wealth. Requires both origin (proof of creation) and ownership (proof of control).

The core Rootz primitive. A blockchain smart contract on Polygon that holds encrypted data with granular access controls. Everything in the Rootz system is built on Secrets. Each Secret is a channel that can hold Notes.

An append-only log of entries attached to a Secret. Like a feed or journal. The mechanism for accumulating data over time within a Data Wallet. Notes are immutable once written -- they can only be added, never modified.

An on-chain smart contract that represents a Digital Name. Manages authorized signers, key rotation, device authorization, and multi-party access. The RootzSigner interface maintains ethers.js Signer compatibility.

The first entry in a Data Wallet, recording WHO created the data, WHAT was created, WHEN it was created (blockchain timestamp), and WHERE (device/domain). Immutable proof of origin that can never be backdated.
The name for the Rootz blockchain infrastructure layer. From Greek episteme (knowledge). The system that manages Secrets, Notes, and Identity Contracts on Polygon mainnet and Amoy testnet.
A sacred interface compatible with ethers.js Signer that bridges hardware security (TPM/Secure Enclave) with blockchain signing operations. Never break ethers.Signer compatibility.

The foundational Rootz philosophy that every digital object should have its own cryptographic wallet. Not for cryptocurrency -- for proving origin, ownership, and enabling granular access control for any data.

The Veritize dual-layer documentation architecture. Plain English is the human-readable Markdown layer (readable by anyone, from a rancher in Montana to a customs agent in London). Plain AI is the machine-ingestible JSON/Schema layer. Every document has both layers -- the Twin Heart.
The Veritize concept of binding a product's physical fingerprint (micro-scratch PUF) to a blockchain-anchored digital identity. Truth becomes a matter of physics, not trust.
A generic QR sticker with only a UUID that becomes a Sovereign Birth Certificate when activated by scanning with a USA Pass. Late-binding architecture that moves at the speed of the factory floor.

An open web standard (/.well-known/ai) proposed by Rootz that makes websites readable, verifiable, and trustworthy for AI agents. Provides structured JSON with organization identity, knowledge base, and update feed — all cryptographically signed by the organization's blockchain Digital Name. The Signed Web.
The Made in USA One / Veritize model: not blind trust, but verified trust with cryptographic proof at the molecular level. Every claim backed by verifiable evidence.

products.name: AI Discovery Standard
products.tagline: The Signed Web — Make Every Website AI-Readable
products.description: An open web standard proposing /.well-known/ai as a structured, cryptographically signed endpoint that tells AI agents who an organization is, what it does, and proves it said it. Three-tier architecture: Discovery (ai.json), Knowledge (knowledge.json), Feed (feed.json). Includes an AI readability scanner that grades websites A-F, an interactive ai.json generator, and a library of copy-paste prompts for implementing on any platform. CC-BY-4.0 licensed, vendor-neutral, free to implement.
keyFeatures: AI Readability Scanner — grades any website A-F on AI readability
Interactive ai.json generator with live preview
AI Prompt Library — copy prompts for Express, Next.js, WordPress, Apache/Nginx
Three-tier data architecture: Discovery, Knowledge, Feed
Cryptographic content signing with SHA-256 hashes
On-chain adoption registry on Polygon
Open specification (CC-BY-4.0)
Cross-industry audit of 16 major websites showing the AI readability gap
